oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Fairs; Exhibition buildings; Commercialism; Pyramids
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of the Memphis-Shelby County building at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition. The building is in the shape of a pyramid. Surrounding the building are Egyptian columns.

The Memphis-Shelby County building was modeled after the Cheops Pyramid because of the city of Memphis and its connection to ancient Memphis, Egypt. Inside the pyramid were displays sponsored by the businesses of Memphis exhibiting commerce and industry.
